metadata.author: Eric J. Rubin, Lindsey R. Baden, Stephen Morrissey
metadata.title: Audio Interview: What Clinicians Need to Know in Diagnosing and Treating Covid-19
metadata.abstract: The rapid spread of SARS-CoV-2, a novel coronavirus that emerged in late 2019, and the resulting Covid-19 disease has been labeled a Public Health Emergency of International Concern by the World Health Organization. What physicians need to know about transmission, diagnosis, and treatment is the subject of ongoing updates from infectious disease experts at the Journal.

introduction: The rapid spread of SARS-CoV-2, a novel coronavirus that emerged in late 2019, and the resulting Covid-19 disease has been labeled a Public Health Emergency of International Concern by the World Health Organization. What physicians need to know about transmission, diagnosis, and treatment is the subject of ongoing updates from infectious disease experts at the Journal.

In this audio interview conducted on March 3, 2020, the editors discuss the current state of SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic testing in the United States and what clinicians can do for patients who test positive.

summary: The rapid spread of SARS-CoV-2, a novel coronavirus that emerged in late 2019, and the resulting Covid-19 disease has been labeled a Public Health Emergency of International Concern by the World Health Organization.
What physicians need to know about transmission, diagnosis, and treatment is the subject of ongoing updates from infectious disease experts at the Journal.

In this audio interview conducted on March 3, 2020, the editors discuss the current state of SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic testing in the United States and what clinicians can do for patients who test positive.
